On april 14, 2017
MinerX

This post will gradually be updated as needed.

Risen Souls is a remake of the old Soul Fray rpg I did a while back.

The thread will be a RPG, i.e. it will use predominantly role-play gadgets for the forums to make events happen, but next to that it'll be like any other game.
Luck will be required.
There will be a story.
The players will kill help each other.

There's a few concepts
Glossary
COMBAT:
I will go on record now to say in this thread, once and forever, in a head or tails throw, TAILS WILL ALWAYS SIGNIFY A SUCCESS.
For simplicity's sake I'll say that LEVEL decides turn order. Higher level= first. On a tie the non-PC goes first.
Unless abilities/items say otherwise, you cannot attack and use said actives in the same turn, but you can use multiple weapon attacks if equipped.
After a accuracy roll, damage roll and applying buffs/debuffs to the damage, % damage block, then flat damage reduction (armor) is applied.
Now I'd love to do a sensible armor system where the armor logically doesn't scale senslessly 1:1, but at the same time I don't want to use a system where you need a calculator and advanced maths knowledge to find out.
So yeah, 1 armor blocks 1 damage.
All stat effects like poison are applied at the end of the turn.

Quicktravel: used to get from one safe place to another, kinda obvious. Attempted misuse will be punished, obviously.

PVP
There are three types of battles past a wild encounter:
-Blue battle: honourably challenged and may be declined without repercussions, both participants are healed to the fullest extent (same as resting since you cannot challenge one with random monsters nearby).
-Red battle: deceitful and spontaneous without a option to decline, everything goes, but the attacker has aggro of all enemies in the vicinity, and might suffer further handicap from the gods. If the attacker successfully kills the first target (when there are more people)he may chose to run while the other opponents cannot instantly re-challenge him, I.e. I tag you and you immediately tag me back is a no-go)
-Yellow battle: usually a event or boss that has special conditions or terms.
These colors might change trough the course of battle and in some cases even affect your spells, affinities or loot! I wonder who will find the tricks behind it all first... Such as this whole update not being mentioned.Along with a weapon system update!

Stat effects:
-Immobilise, lasts based on tier, usually adds accuracy bonuses, when several are applied only the longest lasts.
-Bleed, lasts based on tier, refreshes and stacks when re-applied. -Poison, doesn't refresh, stacks on exception, deals damage and lasts based on tier.
-Toxin, doesn't refresh or stack, deals %hp damage based on tier.
-Burn, continuous and stacks, stack amount based on tier (how many stacks it applies per hit), other burn attacks deal bonus damage based on stacks. Doesn't go away untill healed.
-Ablaze, doesn't stack, refreshes, deals damage and bonus damage if the affected doesn't spend his turn trying to roll.
More to come along the way.
Tier system: (1st given effect is tier 1, 2nd one tier 2, etc.)
-Immobilise: 1 turn, 2 turns, 3 turns...
-Bleed: 2 turns, 3 turns, 4 turns...
-Poison: 2 turns, 4 turns, 6 turns...
-Toxin: 5% hp, 10% hp, 15% hp... (current or max depends on what applies it)
-Burn: 2 stacks, 3 stacks, 4 stacks...
-Ablaze: 2+1 damage, 4+2 damage, 6+3 damage...

Attack modification/weapon system:
-Bow: A weapon used for ranged combat, hence only doing half damage each hit at close range.
-Crossbow: A bow with no drawback except for the fact it would be grossly inefficient to reload mid-battle, so they cost mana to use! Magic!
-Whip: While low in damage, high in accuracy, has a chance to disarm and bind.

Effect names:
-Bash: Stuns opponent for tier amount of turns. Found on most bludgeons.
-Regen: tier mana/health pulled from the surroundings.
-Sap: tier mana/health stolen from enemies.
-Cursed: a effect occurring in a set amount of time or turns.

So, if you're interested keep reading (or go and read the first post of the first thread for more information), because the first thing to do is the character sheet.

CS:
Name:
Appearance: (optional)
Class:
Role:
Character Status:
*This is where all the mechanic based character information is stored*
Status
HP: health
MP: magic
Armor: total armor
Souls:
Level: (100+25*Level souls per levelup)

Equipment:
(most of this will be dealt with logically, i.e. even if you're wearing a helmet you can still wear a scarf etc.

Abilities:
-These are class based/earned trough special quests.
-Some are active, some are passive.
-Class skills are unlocked for leveling up, or you can pass up on immediately leveling your skill for 5 level points for later use/upgrading your stats.
-Abilities are chosen... RANDOMLY (insert my maniacal laugh here) well, pseudo randomly. At this point you might be asking what pseudo-randomnes is. Weeeeellll:
-You get to choose one of the following: give one of my two options a 2/3 chance to be picked, or choose another ability to add into the roll.

Inventory:
-Limited to 20 items

So, classes:
Note, if you want any of the classes in the old thread ask and I'll consider
The classes branch out into roles that have something in common, i.e. the class buffs are shared between all roles under it, but classes have more unique ones, more specifically:

Fighter classes, 50 base health, equipped with a Sword (4 damage), 5 mana base.
Round robin:
R- +5 hp
P- +1 physical damage
S- 10% magic resistance
-Warrior, gains 10 more health and warrior's armor (+1 armor). Ability: Warrior's immunity (Immune to certain status effects). Ability: Strenght (Mele attacks deal +1 damage)
-Guardian, gains a shield (25% bash chance, 1-2 damage, +2 armor).
-Footsoldier, keeps 50% souls on death. Sword replaced by a short spear (4 damage, damages enemies as if they had 1 armor less). Knows fear...

Rogue classes, gain 30 Base hp, 6 mana base, ability: heightened senses, and a dagger (3 damage, +10% hit chance)
Round robin:
R- +5% accuracy
P- +1 physical damage
S- +5% evasion
-Scout, ability: Farsight (gets to find out a bit more about the area and the upcoming ones if possible)
-Assassin, loses 5 Base hp, gets another dagger
-Archer, loses 10 hp, gains a old shortbow (3-4 damage, goes first unless ambushed, has an easier time hitting flying enemies than other weapon types)

Mage classes, gain 20 Base hp, gain 20 mana Base, gain a staff (2 damage, 1 mana regeneration/turn). All classes start with at least one spell.
-Arcane, gains magic rags (allows the wearer to tap into the surrounding superphysical elements of the world)
-Cleric, gains a cracked orb that has a variety of effects
-Battlemage, gains 10 hp, gains a thaumathurgical compass, the staff is replaced by a crescent sickle (4 damage, 1 mana regeneration per weapon damage per hit)

After some progress in the game I might add a job system to further specialise the character, but not yet.

I'll make the character sheets in regard to the stats, if you want to join post your cs minus the status sheet.

Update 1: Sealer added
-Sealer: part of the Mage class (gains 20/20 bases and a staff), staff replaced by ceremonial robes (similar to the magic rags, but weaker) and a stone ceremonial dagger (2 damage base, causes bleeding for 1/turn)

Update 2: Status effects update, upcoming attack modifier update.
Upadate 2.1: The greenbowers is a fucking genious update.

Update 3: (WIP) minor battle, scaling, drop, naming, lore and mechanics overhaul

[8886413]

You roll to hit, then damage and then any status effects. For you, you have 2 daggers which have a Total hit chance of 60%. Therefore, you roll a d100 and try to get under 61. Then, if you have variable damage, you roll for that as well. You always hit for 3, so a normal attack for you would look like this:

Accuracy | Damage
Dagger: d100 => 61 | 3
Dagger: d100 => 61 | 3
